Natural Beauty: Central Park is a stunning oasis of natural beauty in the heart of bustling New York City. The park is home to a wide variety of trees, plants, and wildlife, making it an ideal place to escape the city's noise and chaos and connect with nature.Historical Significance: Central Park is not only a beautiful place but also a significant piece of American history. The park was designed in the 19th century by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux, and it was one of the first public parks in the United States.Cultural Significance: Central Park is a hub for cultural events and activities. The park hosts concerts, festivals, and performances throughout the year, making it an essential part of New York City's cultural scene.Recreational Opportunities: Central Park offers a vast array of recreational opportunities, including running and biking paths, baseball and soccer fields, and even ice skating in the winter. There is something for everyone to enjoy in this vast park.Iconic Landmarks: Central Park is home to some of New York City's most iconic landmarks, including the Central Park Zoo, the Bethesda Fountain, and the Bow Bridge. These landmarks have become synonymous with the park and are must-see attractions for visitors to New York City.In conclusion, Central Park is a true gem in the heart of New York City, offering visitors a unique and unforgettable experience. From its natural beauty to its rich history and cultural significance, there are endless reasons to give Central Park a 5-star review.

Would definitely come back, wish we had a place like that back home. We stopped at the ladies pavillion to have our lunch, they had covered benches by the water and best of all there was a gentleman playing music and singing.   It was awesome.Walked through the ramble.   Then went to Belvedere castle make sure to climb the stairs to the top, it is free to get in.   Beautiful scenery from both observation decks.  Walked past the obelisk and behind the met and walked to the Guggenheim.    We did that all in 3.5 hours with some breaks to sit and have lunch.  Central Park is beautiful, so many different areas to explore.   I’m sure we just scratched the surface.   There are so many benches all over the park and many artists playing and singing scattered all over.  We saw people selling water, fruit cups and ice cream.   I was expecting to see actual food venues, maybe they are in different parts of the park that we did not go to.   So if we came back I would pick up lunch before coming into the park so that we could avoid having to leave the park to get food.  It is an amazing park that you could visit again and again.  We had no time to actually go into the museums, maybe the next time we are back.
Great experience at all!!!! We ride a bike and i loced all the views and I always wanted to experience central park in bike. So it was a hit!
Really enjoyed walking round! Huge park with delights round ever corner. We encountered a crazy local screaming the world is about to end, visited the Zoo, saw a wedding evenLoved it!

There are so many things to see and do in Central Park.  You can pick up a map at the bottom end that will guide you.Around 72nd Street is the Memorial for John Lennon, Strawberry Fields.  A musician sits at the Memorial paying Beatles music.  Yoko Ono still lives at the corner of Central Park and 72nd on the North east corner.  The Courtyard into the building is where John was shot.  Yoko was instrumental in getting the Memorial installed in the Park as they loved it so much.They have ball diamonds, Lawn Bowling, row boats to name but a few activities in the park.

type_review: It’s Central Park, what more is there to say.
text_review: Central Park is easy in my top 5 New York attractions. I always like to plan it towards the end of my trip or at least after a few days as it provides a real contrast/respite to hustle and bustle of the city. It’s a very large park which is the only thing that might not appeal to everyone as there is a lot of walking. I would recommend seeing strawberry fields, the bow bridge and the great lawn.

Was on vacation from July 2nd……Central Park is great for a healthy walk and smell some fresh air.Went for a long walk around Central Park and as well as play area for children, Central Park caters for all.We never felt threatened and felt very welcomed and would recommend spending sometime walking the length and breadth - we was not disappointed.Great location as well getting away from the hustle and bustle of NYC.If attending New York again this would be on our list to visit.10 out of 10 from me 👍

Only got to see the south portion and wish I had more time to explore.  Would have like to have seen a security presence and better signage, including zoo info including costs before arriving at zoo itself.  Do not recommend a CitiBike for this activity, many issues including poorly maintained cycles(flat tires and broken sensors) take a walk and enjoy.

type_review: worth to take a look if you are in NYC
text_review: it's a very large park, depends on which part you want to go , you may need to get off from different subway station. in the park, I recommend to go to Belvedere castle and Bethesda Fountain & Terrace, these are the most beautiful places in the central park

A welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. An awesome way to spend the day or a few hours. Very clean and well maintained green space in the heart of the city. I travel to Manhattan often, but had never taken the time to go until this trip. I truly enjoyed it and will be now be a part of every future visit to New York.

I was pleasantly surprised by how big central park is! It was surprisingly hard to find coffee spots once inside the park. Regardless, I really loved it. I went during Autumn which was gorgeous, and I particularly liked seeing saxophonists playing underneath the bridges, and the contrast between the park with the skyscrapers behind. Definitely worth a visit.

Second time to visit Central Park, but this time, we spend all day wandering around the pathways. My hubby and son rented bikes, but there are bikes to rent by the park itself. As you cycle around the outer roads and have to dismount to head into the boat house,  fountain, etc.Plenty to see, and young and old enjoying the sunshine. Plenty of photo opportunities. When buying fresh fruit or water there don't show your money,  as my son went to buy the fresh fruit and had 6 dollars in his hand and with out us knowing was charged the 6 dollars.  So ask first, how much..1 dollar for water, no more.

Loved Central Park!  It is beautiful, calming, eclectic and interesting!  The zoo is great but my favorite part was walking the Mall.  Musicians and artists are everywhere and dogs are lounging, squirrels are adorable and fruit stands are around for a quick, refreshing treat.

type_review: Every Visit Makes Me Fall in Love All Over Again...
text_review: I spent a delightful early Sunday morning enjoying the park as I made my way towards The Met. It was a sunny June day, not too hot, and the atmosphere could not have been more magical.Every time I visit the park, I realize just how much I enjoy exploring its verdant depths. There's absolutely much more to see, and I know I will be back.
I've been to Central Park probably a dozen times through the years, and I've seen maybe a tenth of it. It's a must-see if you're visiting the world's greatest city.

- must see!- Ask for a map before embarking on your day, it will greatly help you understand the size of the park- In terms of food options, I’d say Central Park is quite limited or… expensive. Take some food and water with you- Walk the length of the Reservoir - its impressive- Visit Strawberry Fields!Imagine Mosaic is often adorned with flowers and serenaded by live musicians playing famous Beatles songs.- Picnic at Sheep Meadow- there are few great photo spots: one close to the Central Zoo

Went for a few days to catch some Broadway shows.  Stayed at the Marriot Marquis in the middle of Times Square.  Great place. Can walk to any show.  Had tickets to Sweeney Todd.  Picked up tickets at the TKTS booth for Moulin Rouge and Some Like it Hot. Great shows for a good price.  Ate at Junior's, John's Pizza, Playwright Irish Pub, and Ellen's Stardust Diner.  No shortage of places to get good food.  Took a side trip to Coney Island on the Q train.  Took Amtrak from Vermont to Penn Station.  Good way to travel.

A wonderful place to get away from all the craziness of NYC. The trails are so nice, and it’s big enough that you don’t feel crowded there. And it seems that there are so many nooks and crannies, you could spend days enjoying the different areas of the park. We walked it on our way to the Natural History Museum and back. It was a decent amount of walking from our hotel in the Times Square area, but it only took us a little over half an hour and an overall easy walk there. I can totally see the appeal of visiting this park, even for us tourists. My wife and I are not excited about the horse carriages though - those horses have to pull people in the hot sun, and I don’t think they really enjoy it.
So many things so see and go. How can you not go here? There were artists, and sights and of course people watching

I spent half day walking around the park and enjoyed lunch i bought from Target nearby. Very airy, relaxing feels & beautiful views of the buildings from the park. Sunday is when the park if mostly full of locals & tourists.

Beautiful Park! There are so many things to do here during so many seasons. It is the gem of Manhattan and it is incredible. There is a zoo, lakes, fountains, trails, fields, baseball fields, soccer fields, gardens, and a gorgeous view of the Central Park towers. I highly recommend.

Carriage driver Mario angelucci is a scam artist.  Do not get into his carriage!    He conducted other business instead of giving us a history of Central Park. The park is huge so we didnt get round it all. It was a sweltering hot day. Well worth a vist. Very pretty surrounded by high rise buildings.

Unfortunately we arrived on the day NY was shrouded in smoke from the Canadian wildfires! I was pleased to find bathrooms available around Central Park . Ok but prefer Green Park / Hyde Park London xx

Well it's huge with lots of accessible paths and cycleways. Beautiful planting and lilac in flower. Several lakes with stunning reflections. You can organise guided tours. Several places to eat or have a picnic. Nearto the subway. If feeling extravagant you can hire a horse and carriageThere are play areas f8r children, maps to show you where you are, information  centres at entry to the park
Beautiful, lots of places to sit and enjoy the view and people watch.  I went on a Sunday and it was all wonderfulk.
Just too far from Dunks... Also way too many trees, hard to take photos cause the trees are just everywhere
We took a carriage ride through the park with Natasha and her horse Sally. Was wonderful seeing the park and of course her describing of all we passed. Very fun and off the beaten track

Lovely park quite overwhelmingly big if you’ve not visited NYC before. Nice that there’s not many roads going through so can really feel like you’re not in the city. Also some beautiful viewpoints from within the park over the lakes.
Loved, loved, loved this park. Great experience! We walked it one day and ran it the second day. Huge lake, lots of trees and plants. Beautiful 😍

The tour was first class and Gary was a first class tour guide, he was very knowledgeable very thorough and very amicable. would have no problems strongly recommending Gary to other groupsThanks Gary for a first class experience Regards DON

Beautiful park with lots of activities annd memorable statues; all the things you would imagine to see there. As out of state visitors it would’ve been helpful to have more signage for direction. It’s frustrating to feel like you’re always lost.
It was nice to visit Central park. Once there, it is peaceful and I enjoyed walking there.Deserves a longer visit.

Loved the park!  We only saw a tiny bit of it near Strawberry Fields and the zoo.  It is very well-kept.  We felt safe.  It was busy but not crowded.  I'm taking points off for not having  bathrooms available, at least not easily.  We were near the zoo, but it was closed unexpectedly, and we were directed like three blocks down to use the bathroom at the Apple Store or The Plaza.

We entered the park just beneath the big lake in the middle. We saw most of the main sights as we criss crossed back towards 5th avenue. I thought they could have done with more maps in the park. Otherwise, we loved it! It does get a lot busier nearer 5th avenue and we got pestered more for horse carriage rides etc.
Central Park is very nice and big territory. You can spend all day around this area with beautiful views of the lake and park itself well maintained.  Lots of beautiful flowers and plants.

A busy place (which place in this city is not?), but with resting points that does make it worth wandering in. One can explore it best in two halves, I would advise, especially if you're already footsore from tramping through the surrounding attractions.

Spent a lot of time in Central Park. Plenty of space and never felt crowded. Walked as far as the reservoir. Would like more places/kiosks to get something to eat or drink rather than those on the edge.

Central Park is an extremely large green space in New York. It has over around 20 playgrounds, several man made lakes and ponds, arched bridges, and extensive paths for walking, running and biking. Truly the first thing you notice about Central Park is that it is vast. Apparently an estimated 42 million visitors enter the park every year, making it one of the most visited tourist attractions in the world. My wife and I visited on the afternoon while in the area and now can understand the attraction. Really it was fantastic. The Harlem Meer was wonderful with the turtles swimming here and there, Belvedere Tower was extremely interesting, and the John Lennon tribute Strawberry Fields was touching. These were just three of many highlights of an amazing park. My wife and I really enjoyed our visit and after 4 hours of consistent walking had still only seen a small portion of this inner city wonder. New Yorkers you're so fortunate to have this joy of a park.

type_review: So nice to return after a long break
text_review: It was our first trip to NYC after the pandemic, so naturally we were very excited to be in Central Park again. I have noticed some changes after our last visit: the construction work on the two new skyscrapers has been finished. One of them is the famous “Needle” on the 111 West 57th Street, the second tallest building in the Western Hemisphere and the skinniest in the world. It is absolutely stunning! I took so many photos of it from the alleys of the Central Park! The park is gorgeous as ever and it was so nice to see its lush greenery in its summer best. The day after we walked in Central Park again, on our way to the Metropolitan Museum of Arts, and on the way back to our hotel we got lost, so I had more time to enjoy the beauty of its ponds, bridges, flowers and leafy trees. Gorgeous!
No need to explain in long words. It is the must-go place when you visit Manhattan. My family really enjoyed every part of it.
For every time I visit New York I kind of appreciate this park more and more  for it is more than a lung for NYC, it is also a meeting point for all its people doing different activities.

The weather was perfect for a wander round Central Park on more than one occasion in May.  It is so big and I don’t think we saw the same place twice.  There is music - from Beatles songs in Strawberry Fields to string trios at the other side.  It does get busy which is part of its charm - all the world is there during the day. Then you suddenly come upon an obelisk and then the Alice In Wonderland statue.  Watch out for cyclists and runners on the m as in routes.
We had a walk around the park and visited the zoo which was a good addition to the visit. Great views of the city from the park and a lovely place to wander around or sit and chill.
Great escape from the city after a few days. Hired some bikes and cycled around the whole park which I would recommend. Nice park - even watched some sort ball. Enjoyed!

type_review: Good for a couple of hours!

type_review: One of world's most remarkable parks - lots to see & do without spend any money

People and animal watching is wonderful here.We loved the clock (see below),  the rocks, playgrounds, people watching, reading signs on the benches.    None of this cost a cent.SO fun.

We visited the park for multiple reasons, to see the zoo (not pay for entry just walk through), see Bethesda terrace and Fountain, to see Strawberry fields, to see the Dakota and San Remo buildings that border the Park. It was a very warm Memorial Day and the park was very busy. There were lots sunbathing and exercising. Crossings were precarious if they weren’t at designated points and signed to cross. Lots of bikes, scooters, joggers, horse and carts and so on.The park is enormous, we only really covered the bottom third. It’s also a lot more enclosed than I expected, I thought the vistas would be more expansive, but with the undulations, the rocks and the planting it actually creates lots of smaller spaces. It was easy enough to find our way round and there are maps available at staffed kiosks if you do need help.My favourite part was just sitting and watching the world go by. Beautiful space.

We have been to Central Park many times and each time saw different parts of it.  This time we entered across from the Plaza Hotel and walked past the Zoo entrance.  You are able to see the sea lions exhibit and feeding and show from the walkway.  There are many park benches to stop and rest and just people watch.
Must visit venue ….. but watch out for the 3 wheel bike drivers & horse buggy’s .. expensive !! Pester you one after the other
Huge park, interesting locations, beautiful trees.  Spend a couple of hours or a couple of days.  Don't miss Central Park!

I really enjoyed Central park,  it was quiet and peaceful. My favourite spot is the park area, opposite the park plaza hotel. Many architectural sites are available and interesting sidewalk-mosaic tribute to John Lennon. Relax and walk

The views were beautiful! Love the green space! Forgot I was in New York for a sec! Lol .It’s a great park and still need to explore more of it! Coming back for sure!

Beautiful park, I wasn’t aware how large the park is with so many interesting areas We took a horse drawn carriage ride which was lovely but travellers beware if you are taking this ride go around into the park entrance and book direct, we were approached outside Columbus Circle station and paid over $25 for the same ride not realising!

Really large park in the centre of the city. Loads of places to sit and plenty of walkways. There are several things to see in the park including Belvedere Castle, Shakespeare Garden, Turtle Pond and Bethesda Terrace to name a few. There is also a zoo in the park and a couple of ponds. Well worth a visit to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city streets.
So many things to do. Definitely recommend renting a bike and riding the short and long loops. A great place to people watch.

type_review: Excellent birding hub within the heart of New York bird one of attraction besides a many more activity.

Central park has great lakes teeming with terrapins (turtles) and fish, wild birds, trees, rocks and even history. Plenty of benches to rest your feet. Only, take a packed lunch as there are precious few places around to buy food.

Visited Central Park last week. An amazing oasis in a concrete jungle. Really loved the green spaces and miles and miles of walking area. A very well maintained place.

Thought about a carriage ride but we were quoted 15 minutes on the busy road outside only for $65. To go inside the park it was obvious the price was going to shoot up to double or treble that for more time. The park must be a great facility for locals and it’s great that a big city has such a  green resource. But if you are a tourist you may well have better parks and green spaces at home. The Imagine mosaic could do with a bit of a clean.

It was bigger than I expected.  I really enjoyed the carousal.   Plus, we got a picture where the You got Mail was filmed and Sex in the City benches.

We walk around it ,it took us about 3 hours,the weather was a very sunny day, the views around the park was  lovely and the zoo was very good for your money

Whether you are trying to get a workout in visit the sights or just relax, Central Park has something for everyone. There are miles of paths, wide open spaces, monuments, statues, bodies of water and more that you can check out.
This is one of my favorite places in NY. Was amazed by the delightful trees and the Angel of water was mesmerizing, must see.

A beautiful place to visit during  spring the park was alive with visitors & local residents going about their day the plants, flowers & trees were in full bloom & lots of activities to watch & listen too, whilst strolling or sitting for drinks or snacks, would recommend the horse & carriage ride through the park to see & watch all that was on offer & learn about the history of the park & surrounding buildings, thoroughly enjoyed our visit..

We loved Central Park. We didn’t use a horse and carriage as quite $$$ but if you had money a lovely way to explore. Central Park is a beautiful place and it is great that there are parts allocated for people and no dogs allowed. The horse carriages are extremely expensive and we had better time just walking around. Lots of little stands to get drinks, ice creams and hot dogs etc.

Took a walk through Central Park in the morning to experience this lung of the city. Trekked around the park, walked by the Zoo, the literary walk to the Bethesda terrace and then back to 59th street, all very enjoyable.

text_review: We took a horse & carriage ($140 for 40 minutes/4 people) which was lovely. We had no concept of the size of the park but also the different parts are so interesting. It isn't just a flat rectangular green space, there are roads, hills, steps, wildlife, seating areas, eateries. Could easily spend two days there and not be bored! An absolute must see!

type_review: Love walking through the Nature of Central Park
text_review: I recommend took and entire day to walk through Central Park, I was there for hours and I can stay more, just sit to read a book, enjoy the swings there, go through the Strawberry fields forever and lakes. You are going to see a lot of squirrels also!

type_review: Beautiful horse and carriage ride through Central Park
text_review: We had a wonderful horse and carriage ride through Central Park on a slightly wet and chilly April evening. Our guide was amazing and we were so warm with our blankets. He knew all the history of the park and could relate some areas to popular scenes in movies like home alone which my children could relate to. If you don’t have time to walk the park or you just want an experience I would recommend you take a ride through the park. If you go to the entrance the horse and carriages are lined up. Go to the first one in the line. The cost was $140 US plus gratuities ($170) for 1 hour and it was well worth it and highly recommended.

This is a really nice park. Has a lot to do. I obviously didn’t walk the whole thing as it is HUGE but it was a nice stroll. If you want something from a food cart, bring cash as some don’t accept cards. I went around 12:00 and there wasn’t tons of people. I recommend walking around here 🙂

When in NYC, you have to visit Central Park, right?  And surely it’s better to join the runners on their way round?  Of course it is!  But also, it’s worth stopping to look at all the interesting statues, ponds, wildlife etc.But stay safe and go in daylight
The park was relaxing and beautiful. We enjoyed walking and admiring the natural beauty. It is a nice get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

type_review: A must-visit destination for anyone looking to explore the city
text_review: From the free concerts in the summer to the lush gardens and world-famous sculptures, this park is a great way to spend a day. The lively atmosphere and friendly locals make it a great place to relax and enjoy the scenery. Whether you're looking for a romantic stroll, a family outing, or a day of exploring, Central Park is the perfect place to do it. Its many attractions, including the carousel and the zoo, make it a great spot for kids and adults alike. With something for everyone, Central Park is a great destination for a day or two of fun.

You can forget you are in the city in the Brambles in the summer but the view in Winter through the deciduous trees are equally remarkable.  The supertall buildings on 57th add a new dimension.   Still great to wander by the statue of Balto and immerse in the Central Park zoo.

We had a great day in the park during our last trip to New York. It was a warm spring day, jackets off strolling around. By looking at the map I knew Central Park was large. Walking around, it is huge. A peaceful. Definitively coming back!

We had a great and complete view of Central Park. Our guide Jaffa knew everything about the Park, buildings around it and people who lived in those buildings, with great detail about John Lennon’s murderer. A great experience, to repeat next time at NYC!
A wonderful place in the heart of the city..bigger than you think.Go see Strawberry fields opposite John Lennon s old apartment.
During January it was stunning with frozen lakes and snow on the ground. It is also great in summer when more people are about enjoying the weather.

type_review: Central Park in March does not disappoint
text_review: Visited Central Park after our trip to the Museum of Natural History.  Amazing to find such a relaxing place in the middle of the city.  Enjoyed our time.

This was expensive as we paid the driver $100 and the journey turned out to be much shorter than we had been expecting. However, the driver was lovely he was well informed and his horse cooper was well behaved. We loved the visit and for us it was well worth the expense.
My first time there and I thoroughly enjoyed it. So much to see and enjoy. We enjoyed the sights, entertainment and the beauty of it right in the heart of NY. Can't wait to go again.

type_review: Huge park in the heart of Manhattan
text_review: Central Park is a huge open area in the heart of Manhattan. It's the jewel of NYC. Apart from the lawn, there's a huge water feature, with row boats. Many people like to picnic here. If you are traveling by foot, the Park is great for walking. The Park is a lot safer than it once was, but it's best not to push your luck and walk through it late at night. Central Park is inviting; it almost divides NYC i in two; it is a great asset to the City.

type_review: A wonderful oasis in a chaotic City
text_review: Just a fabulous place in a city that never stops. We spent a whole day just meandering through the park taking in the Woolmer Rink, Bethesda Terrace and the lake, all the way up to the reservoir and the oddly random Belvedere Castle. The park is bright and vibrant (and this was very early Spring) with musicians and artists dotted around, people and families just out for a walk in the air. All the while surrounded by the buildings and sky scrapers of an international city that is never out of eyeline but certainly out of earshot. The only downside is the horse/cart rides, they absolutely reek both as they stand at the park entrances and when they slowly pass you in the park!

type_review: Amadou Tours was Excellent, Knowledgable & brilliant Value.  Must Recommend.
text_review: Amadou Tours. Cycled us around this great place.  Amadou knew the park really well stopping at All the Relevant places taking really good photos of us. 1st time in New York late Feb 23.  Informative Amadou was a mountain of knowledge.  Really good value.  Make a beeline for Amadou!

type_review: Never Enough Time in Central Park
text_review: Due to our quick visit we opted to ride bikes on the Central Park loop so we could take in as much as possible. It was fun to see all of the families with children, the dogs of every size, and we also enjoyed taking pictures throughout the park.
As part of our tour, we made a stop at Strawberry Fields in Central Park. The beautiful scenery and serene atmosphere are sure to be even more impressive when nature is in full bloom.

type_review: Great wee stroll in the park…..
text_review: Love this place. It’s the park to escape the cars, people and big buildings. Never went to the zoo, we walked all round it and just enjoyed it. Would not even think of the horse carriages, those wee souls look like they need set free to a ranch!
We had a pedi cab ride round Central Park with Ali which was booked through Central Park attractions. Ali was very funny and knowledgeable.

Living out childhood dreams. As a Sydney girl, getting to go over and see the beauty that is central park was a dream come true! What was even better is we saw it with SNOW! Pointing out certain places from movies, etc!

type_review: Must see if you're visiting Manhattan
text_review: Visiting the park was a true delight! We took an hour and a half tour provided by the Central Park Conservancy and it was excellent. We would have happily spent the entire day with our guide Desiree. The conservancy does a great job of maintaining the park. It definitely was a highlight of our visit to Manhattan.

We saw a redtailed  hawk in a tree after we left the Guggenheim. It was so magical. It just sat there and then started flying in circles overhead.  I love this park. I wish we had more time to walk along the water.
We walked from south to north of Central Park, and it really is packed with sports areas, lakes, streams and lots to see and do. A must do when in NYC

type_review: Amazing park in the middle of the city
text_review: Amazing to walk thru this park, probably even better other times of the year when warmer weather. Recommended.

What turned out to be a beautiful day when we had a lovely stroll around the park. It made a break from rushing around seeing all the sights NYC has to offer. Lovely and peaceful and impressive views of the skyline overlooking the park.
We always visit Central Park when we come to NYC. Sunday afternoon in spring was just lovely. Safe vibrant and clean you shouldn’t miss this.

type_review: A must when visiting New York but need plenty of time
text_review: We visited in December so it was cold but absolutely loved the whole area, we did a 2 hour bike tour round the park which meant we covered a decent area of the park and had a few highlights pointed out by our tour guide. I would think you need more then a whole day so do the park suggest, there is so much to see.

ing oasis in the heart of New York City. It offers a variety of attractions, from scenic lakes and bridges to iconic landmarks and statues. Whether you want to relax, explore, or enjoy some culture, Central Park has something for everyone. Don't miss this urban gem!

A beautiful park with lots of history and great scenery. Almost ever corner of the park will spark memories of scenes from a movie or show series. Lots of areas to take photos that are perfect for the instagram, and or a nice romantic walk on a sunny day. The park is surrounded by buildings worth visiting like museums, condos of famous celebrities, and when you feel like shopping the famous Bloomingdales. It's only about a 20min walk from Times Square, and definitely something worth visiting.
This is my favourite place for morning runs whenever at New York. The stretch is beautiful with enthusiasts all around the park doing group exercises, cycling, running etc.

type_review: Wonderful!. It was a nice change of pace from the hustle and bustle of the cities attractions..
text_review: Took a LONG LONG LONG walk through the park. Squirrels looked tough, careful not to look them directly in the eyes, lol. We went in winter and it was just as special. Multiple skating rinks and places to lay down. We walked around the immense water retention lake, and the smaller one too.Check out the visitors center on the north end of the park, friendly attendants and souvenirs.Just a pleasure.
We stopped at Central Park at Strawberry Fields as part of a tour.  In January, there isn't a lot to see.  However, one could imagine how fantastic it would be in better weather.

type_review: Central Park has history as well as nature
text_review: Went on a sculpture and monuments tour of central  park led by  Jose.   Guide was knowledgeable and entertaining.  He was generous in sharing his knowledge including talking about trees which wasn’t specifically on the tour

type_review: Every year we have to go
text_review: Every year we pay a visit to beatiful CENTRAL PARK, and every year we talk about moving here to live.It's beyond words, like an oasis in the middle of busy NY.This year we tried first-timers the Carruage Stroll, very funny.
You have to go there early just to get the whole experience but I did enjoy what I did see. I will go back one day just to complete the whole thing

type_review: Great place to chill a bit

Central Park is one of my favorite parts about visiting NYC. My daughter and I went twice during our 4 days visit to NYC, we strolled and talked for hours! The locals walking around on a Sunday morning, with all their dogs - it was so much fun!

type_review: A place to visit, I enjoyed it very much
text_review: Central Park is a giant oasis of flora and fauna located in the heart of New York. Here you can find plazas, gardens, and green spaces for people to play, exercise, and take a stroll. It's also a place to observe the many scenes of everyday life and admire the picturesque scenery. Plus, there are a variety of art performances like theater, outdoor theater, plays, and music. Central Park is a place of great value and beauty.
Spent a while just sitting, people watching. Once pass the vendors, trying to get you to ride a horse, bike etc,  it was really peaceful.

Clean tidy park. The ice rink was extremely good. We managed to get on a horse and carriage. This was excellent as we learn more about the buildings and people who live in the buildings around Central Park.We also learnt the film locations which were filmed in Central Park . A very knowledgeable tour guide which helped us know more about the park.
Walking Round the park was an experience I'll never forget. One minute, you're looking at the trees, etc . Turn around and then you see the skyscrapers !!!!
Beautiful park with loads to see and do. Take a ride on the horse drawn buggy - don’t pay too much, average is $65 for 20 mins.

This huge park is nice in every season. Take a stroll through the parkland, visit the zoo, take a bike ride or jog. A beautiful place for recreation. Kept very  clean.

There are always a great group of musicians and fans there singing Beatles songs and remembering all of the music they gave the  world.

You could easily play football-soccer there Holland - US. You can smell the nature which Central Park breathes. Nice trees. Though I couldnt find a speakers corner like in Hyde Park in London. Unfortunately I couldn't make a picture of me in the park cause my mobile battery was finished but we will be back so next time better.

we picked the coldest day for a walk in the park, but it was so worth it. beautiful scenery, even made some friends with some squirrels. caramel coffee hit the spot! felt very safe, was looking for the friend's fountain * typical tourist* didn't disappoint. can't wait to return but hopefully in summer when it's not so cold.
Beautiful park, home to the Zoo, numerous biking/running paths, just a wonderful oasis in a concrete jungle!
An open space in the 24-7 city. Nowadays it is safe and a pleasing place to spend some time walking and grabbing a coffee.

type_review: Oasis of calm in a frantic city
text_review: On our latest visit to Central Park in January 2023 we spent one morning covering most of the park even though it was windy and raw. Central Park is varied with very distinct areas and styles, there is a feeling of sanctuary at any point in the park. Although it is so close to the frantic city it can feel a million  miles away when at one of the lakes or in the wooded areas. It is one of the highlights of New York and even though it was bone-chilling when we went it was still worth revisiting.

Really enjoyed our trip to New York City, loved Central Park, we had a little walk but soon realised there was much to see, so hiring a bike was a must, 12 miles later we’d seen the complete park, stopping along the way admiring the views….

A great place to escape the crowded streets, great viewpoints of the city too and great to cycle around.
A beautiful park, lots of culture and history to go with it. Make sure you bring comfortable walking shoes though as it’s huge. We even popped over the the plaza hotel (from home alone 2).

type_review: Refreshing Greenery in the Midst of NYC.
text_review: When I heard that Central Park was over 800 acres of space, I decided to use the horse-drawn carriage as my mode of transport for my park viewing. In spite of its size, it was crowded in spots. Someone was shooting a portion of a film which provided an attraction and joggers, walkers and people-watchers abound.The park is just chucked with iconic sights. I twigged to the Bow Bridge, Bethesda Terrace and the picturesque Conservatory Gardens. Its hard not to find a shopping venue in NYC.....and yes Central Park has its own mall.

It must be a wonderful place in the warmer months but on a cold, blustery, rainy day in January we did not see it at its best. You could still get a taste of the variety of walks available and the exposed granite bedrock is impressive. Our guide was informative on the history behind the creation of the park and the bragging rights depending on where you live, adjoining the park.

One of the main highlights of the city! This park is beautiful, I went several times during my stay in NY.First, I went just for a walk around and it was such a peaceful experience that I really loved, so many gorgeous spots.I also, visited the Zoo this time.And to end this visit, I went to the Strawberry Fields, this spot has such a lovely vibe, there's people singing The Beatles songs and just chilling.Second visit, I rented a bike and did 2 loops around the park and it was one of the best experiences! I felt like I was in a movie, and even though it was tiring, I don't regret it one bit.Last time, I went for a 5k run, and wow... Simply amazing, one of the best runs I've ever had! I also loved to see a lot of runners training for the marathon, incredible experience.

I have been in Central Park many times and will never get bored of it. A large natural resource with excellent sceneries, lakes, zoo, playgrounds, restaurants, and various facilities for running and sports. At the heart of a busy city like New York having this jewel is a blessing.
A must see while in the city! Really enjoyable to ride round on a tandem bike! Really nice to just relax and take in the breathtaking views and step back from the busy hustle of the city!

type_review: Always a super place to see
text_review: We always go to Central Park when in New York. It has so many areas of interest and beautiful spots. it is a must see.

type_review: Do the horse drawn carriage ride
text_review: Great Tour. Affordable. Handsome Jack horse and his guide are awesome. Picture perfect opportunities.  Relaxing and beautiful, even for a family of four.

Love this park. Walked around the whole of it. You do not realise how vast it is until you try to find something like the Home Alone 2 bridge location which we were looking in the totally wrong place. Google it and you can find it. It is near the Zoo area. Did not like seeing the poor horses having to pull often large people. The park itself is well maintained and there is a lot of wildlife. I imagine it is fantastic to see in the Spring and Autumn.

type_review: Lovely park to visit and peaceful
text_review: Lovely and peaceful place to walk around.Lovely to see the Bird Sanctuary.Various rock formations around.I saw the Arch and Bridge from Home Alone 2.Lost in New York.The Dairy House was good to visit with lovely gifts to buy and a free map .Saw plenty of horse and carriages and bikes to hire but was lovely to walk around.

Walking through the park is always one of the highlights of our yearly trip to New York City. It’s always different depending on the weather. The people are always friendly and there’s plenty of birds and squirrels to watch.

type_review: Superb Park with so much to do.
text_review: Booked a Horse and cart tour for family. We were well looked after by Oscar and his horse Strawberry. Lots of information on what you could see and what films were shot there. Revisited for a walk and visit to the zoo which was well worth the money. Great day if weather allows.

type_review: Wollman Ice Skating - Worth the Visit!
text_review: I took the wife and kids (teenagers) here on Friday night (January 6th). We did the "Premium" pass along with the general admission, and used the ice rinks skates (didn't have ours with us). It was a great time! We got there at 7:30pm (for our 8pm timed entry) and was immediately escorted to the semi-private heating tent where we received our dry and clean ice skate rentals. No lines to wait in, no fuss, no lockers to rent, and a safe place to leave our shoes and my wife/daughters' bags. We received 'free' hot chocolate and tea plus a few cookies (it's part of the premium package) about and hour into our skating time (when the Zamboni machine repaired the ice), all while sitting in the ~60 degree heated tent (way warmer than the 38-degrees outside). We then skated again for another 90 minutes before walking back to our hotel just south of the park. This was one of my favorite parts of our Winter 2023 visit to NYC!

type_review: The carriage ride was the perfect end to a very busy day
text_review: The carriage ride was a perfect end to a very busy day.  Robert and Gino were excellent hosts and carried us, well.

type_review: Spend the day in the park
text_review: With all that NYC has to offer, Central Park can easily be overlooked. It has so much to offer. We started with breakfast at a nearby cafe followed by hours of adventure.

An absolutely wonderful experience. Your are offered a horse drawn carriage or an electric rickshaw, the latter is be better choice. Driver puts a blanket over you knees and is attentive.  He pulls over at all the good sites, fountains and explains them and offer to take pics. Very knowledgeable with lots of phot ops. I left my biggest tip of the week.

type_review: Lovely place, would love to see it in spring or summer
text_review: Beautiful place! I couldn’t get over the scale of it and regret that we didn’t allocate enough time to it on our trip, we missed so much. I would definitely do that differently if we ever come back.
If you are doing this do it by a rickshaw or horse and carriage to get the guided tour the guides are really good.  The park is lovely but I bet would be amazing in spring through to autumn.

I had to give this an average review, which is not reflective of the park itself, which is awesome, but the pedicabs should be researched thoroughly before commitment.Before we got into the pedicab we were sure of the price, the duration, and what we would see.  When we disembarked he got his price list out and was charging us x3 what we had agreed.  It turned into quite an unpleasant exchange in the middle of the street with him shouting f u at us repeatedly, when in fact the issue was that he was unclear when he advised on the price.So, aside from that experience Central Park is not to be missed, it will take a considerable time to see everything, so plan ahead.

type_review: Don’t just hear about it, go visit!

I love visiting NYC however getting to Central Park is a great way to slow down and recharge your batteries.  There is so much to see and surrounding you are the giant towers of upper Manhattan.
I ventured into then park today, I had such a peaceful time. I will come more often to read and get my homework done.

If you get a chance to book the Boathouse for lunch before they close for good in October, jump at the chance. Classy, beautiful and surprisingly In-expensive. our hotel was close to the park, so we could be there for a long time,  we had very nice weather so I enjoyed walking with my mobility scooter. most of the park is accessible but some parts are not. should be signed better

We took a NYC carriage ride through Central Park. The other 2 in my group had never been to NYC. I’ve taken carriage rides in Central Park many times, and this was the most enjoyable. Easy to get here via the subway lines. It was nice to see families out, joggers, friends. The cool morning weather and sunny skies helped lift moods. There were horse buggy rides available but I preferred not to spend when I love long walks anyway.

Central Park is an icon in New York but also a place to recharge your “nature batteries” away from all the busyness outside.Being the 5th largest park in New York and covering 843 acres (341 ha), it’s a popular place for a variety of people. Interestingly, it’s the most visited urban park in the United States, with an estimated 45 million visitors annually and is the most filmed location in the world.You can tap into an audio guide on your phone, just follow the sign prompts.We entered via the gate near the Guggenheim and walked through the walled grounds, following the tracks, paths and roads from one side of the park to the other. It’s delightful to see people sitting in the shade reading a book, listening to music or baking themselves in the sun. Kids playing ball or a nanny pushing the pram around with a sleepy baby. A group practising Tai Chi and a small gathering practising yoga. The multiple lakes attract the turtles, bird life and of course, people in row boats. There are plenty of spaces to stop and soak up the park, either near the paths or away from others with some privacy. There are many attractions including landscapes such as the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir and Sheep Meadow. Plus amusement attractions of Central Park Carousels, Strawberry Fields Memorial for John Lennon, Wollman Rink and  Central Park Zoo. There is so much more to see, too many to list here. The Park has a diverse ecosystem with several hundred species of flora and fauna and the diversity is what makes it unique. From one end to the other it’s lovely to soak up everything the Park has to offer. You can catch a carriage and horse ride, pedicab, ride your own bike, drive or walk through the park. Many events and concerts are also held throughout the year.This is a 365 day, 24 hour a day space that changes with the time of day, the weather and the seasons.I only saw 20% and can’t wait to discover more of this amazing green space in the middle of the metropolis that is New York.

type_review: One of the must to be seen
text_review: Central Park is a great attraction but in my opinion you need to have a day to explore it all. It’s huge and in hot weather there aren’t many shaded areas so sit. So plan your visit time wisely, take plenty of water although there are plenty of water fillers around the park. Expect to pay double for any snacks, drinks or ice cream you buy in the park… best to take your own food and drinks. If you cant walk a lot then you can take a ride with one of the bike rickshaw there are plenty at the start of the park.

We mostly walked around the south side, the Roller rink was going while we were there and it looked like a fun time.  The was a large amount of tourists for a Sunday night though and as a result a lot more garbage laying around than normal. That's mostly on the poeple who don't respect the places they visit though.

type_review: Go on a bike or scooter
text_review: Gorgeous! Crowded as can be! Clean. Stay in your lane ( bikes, walkers, …). Be honest about how much time you want to spend at each site. If you want to spend a half hour at Bethesda Fountain, don’t take a tour. If you are good with a quick walk through take a tour. There are bathrooms on the stairs at Bethesda Fountain. The bathrooms weren’t the cleanest and the stall height is low. There was soap, water, toilet paper… there were steps down to the restroom. There were food trucks with water in the area. Belvedere Castle is crowded. If you have mobility issues, there is a fairly steep hill through the Shakespeare Garden and steps up to the castle. It’s not a ‘castle’ in the European sense. Keep in mind if you visit with mobility issues or strollers it’s not a flat park. I will definitely return!

type_review: Do not use the horse carriages use the cycle guys
text_review: Beautiful park, we paid $130 for one hour guy to cycle us around . PLEASE DO NOT USE the horses, though the internet tells you they are checked twice yearly, they’re hip bones are quite prominent, it’s sad to see and the only way to stop it is do not use it. The cycle guys take you round, take pics for you and know the area well, pointing out various places. There are turtles in the lake which is nice to see and it’s a nice break from the cars and traffic.
